vote.vote.passed_multi: Multiple parts of this vote passed. ({letters})
vote.change_block.name: Change Blocking
vote.change_block.desc:
We should make blocking based on time rather than post count, because I totally record when posts were made.

I don't do that, by the way.
vote.mentioned.achievements.name: Achievements
vote.mentioned.achievements.desc: Various achievements that could be completed for rewards (usually just Misc EXP).
vote.mentioned.species.name: Species Effects
vote.mentioned.species.desc: Makes it so that the species of your character actually has an effect. Well, you'd need to define the effect(s) first.
vote.mentioned.encounters.name: Random Encounters
vote.mentioned.encounters.desc: Makes it so that, while using some skills, there'd be a chance for a random enemy to spawn, assuming the enemy slots aren't full.
vote.mentioned.armies.name: Recruitable Armies
vote.mentioned.armies.desc: Would allow you to have extra allies, though the extras would be simpler, provide less benefits, and would not act without input.
vote.mentioned.abilities.name: Usable Abilities
vote.mentioned.abilities.desc: Makes it so that some equipment grant unique abilities that you could use in exchange for additional benefits, and would also probably add some sort of mana system. You could also use the abilities without the equipment, but it wouldn't do as much.

item.null.desc: Whoops, forgot to put something here.
item.wood_sword.desc: A sword made out of wood.
item.wood_shovel.desc: A shovel made out of wood.
item.stick_rock.desc: A rock taped to a stick. This isn't very good.
item.gold_carrot.desc:
A carrot made out of gold. Aren't carrots supposed to give you better eyesight?

A dragon would probably like this.
item.diamond_shield.desc: A shield with a diamond in the center.
item.gold_sword.desc: A sword made out of gold. Seems fragile.
item.gold_shovel.desc: A shovel made out of gold. Seems fragile.
item.gold_pickaxe.desc: A pickaxe made out of gold. Seems fragile.
item.gold_axe.desc: A axe made out of gold. Seems fragile.
item.iron_sword.desc: A sword made out of iron.
item.iron_shovel.desc: A shovel made out of iron.
item.iron_pickaxe.desc: A pickaxe made out of iron.
item.iron_axe.desc: A axe made out of iron.
item.stone_sword.desc: A sword made out of stone.
item.stone_shovel.desc: A shovel made out of stone.
item.stone_pickaxe.desc: A pickaxe made out of stone.
item.stone_axe.desc: A axe made out of stone.
item.diamond_sword.desc: A sword made out of diamonds.
item.diamond_shovel.desc: A shovel made out of diamonds.
item.diamond_pickaxe.desc: A pickaxe made out of diamonds.
item.diamond_axe.desc: A axe made out of diamonds.
item.wood_pickaxe.desc: A pickaxe made out of wood.
item.wood_axe.desc: A axe made out of wood.
item.logo_f.desc: The "F" from the logo. Why's it so small now?
item.diamond.desc: It's a diamond. These things are rare!
item.stick_item.desc: It's a stick. You can use it in a bunch of different things.
item.crop_mush.desc: Eww, why did you keep this?
item.sand.desc: A cube of sand. Carful, or it'll get everywhere.
item.red_sand.desc: A cube of red sand. It's red because of iron. I think.
item.gravel.desc: A cube of gravel. Maybe there's some flint in there?
item.stone.desc: A cube of stone. Finally, some decent tools!
item.bricks.desc: A cube of bricks. You could make a wall out of this.
item.stone_bricks.desc: A cube of stone bricks. You could make a wall out of this.
item.sandstone_bricks.desc: A cube of sandstone bricks. You could make a wall out of this.
item.red_sandstone_bricks.desc: A cube of red sandstone bricks. You could make a wall out of this.
item.carved_sandstone.desc: A cube of carved sandstone. Nice carvings.
item.red_carved_sandstone.desc: A cube of carved red sandstone. What, exactly, are those carvings supposed to represent?
item.glass_block.desc: A cube of glass. See-through, which makes up for its fragility.
item.diamond_legs.desc: A pair of leggings made of diamond.
item.diamond_boots.desc: A pair of boots made of diamond.
item.gold_apple.desc: A golden apple. One of the more common golden foods, and the only edible one.
item.orange.desc: An orange. Not very similar to an apple, which is why they're compared so often.
item.gold_orange.desc: A golden orange. No one knows whether it's golden on the inside, because the peel is solid gold and can't be removed.
item.carrot.desc:
A carrot. It's orange.

A dragon would probably like this.
item.clay_shield.desc: A shield made of clay. Try to avoid letting it shatter.
item.iron_ore.desc: Some iron ore. Can be crafted into bars, requiring 2 ore per bar.
item.copper_ore.desc: Some copper ore. Can be crafted into bars, requiring 1 ore per bar.
item.gold_ore.desc: Some gold ore. Can be crafted into bars, requiring 1 ore per bar.
item.gold_bar.desc: A bar of solid gold. Actually kind of soft for a metal.
item.iron_bar.desc: A bar of solid iron. It's pretty sturdy.
item.copper_bar.desc: A bar of solid copper. Try to avoid getting it oxidized.
item.water.desc: One (1) level of water. Good for 0.5 turns of plant growth.
item.emerald.desc: It's an emerald. These things are rare!
item.hardite_ore.desc: Some hardite ore. Can be crafted into bars, requiring 3 ore per bar.
item.hardite_bar.desc: A bar of solid hardite, named after both how hard it is to get, and how hard it is as a material. This stuff can cut diamond!
item.rock_on_stick.desc: A rock fastened to a stick with more rock. Better than just using tape.
item.sandstone_brick_wall.desc: A wall made of Sandstone Bricks.
item.red_sandstone_brick_wall.desc: A wall made of Red Sandstone Bricks.
item.stone_brick_wall.desc: A wall made of Stone Bricks.
item.oak_plank_wall.desc: A wall made of Oak Planks.
item.birch_plank_wall.desc: A wall made of Birch Planks.
item.bow.desc: A bow. You can shoot arrows with it.
item.fire_arrow.desc: An arrow that's been set on fire.
item.empty_can.desc: A can with nothing in it.
item.water_can.desc: A can with water in it. You can drink it.
item.beans_can.desc: A can with beans in it.
item.gold_bean_can.desc: A golden can with golden beans in it.
item.red_tulip.desc: A red tulip. Can be turned into red dye.
item.orange_tulip.desc: An orange tulip. Can be turned into orange dye.
item.yellow_tulip.desc: A yellow tulip. Can be turned into yellow dye.
item.cyan_tulip.desc: A cyan tulip. Can be turned into cyan dye.
item.azure_tulip.desc: An azure tulip. Can be turned into cyan dye.
item.blue_tulip.desc: A blue tulip. Can be turned into blue dye.
item.purple_tulip.desc: A purple tulip. Can be turned into purple dye.
item.magenta_tulip.desc: A magenta tulip. Can be turned into magenta dye.
item.white_dandelion.desc: A white dandelion. Can be turned into white dye.
item.gray_dandelion.desc: A gray dandelion. Can be turned into gray dye.
item.yellow_dandelion.desc: A yellow dandelion. Can be turned into yellow dye.
item.dirt.desc: A block of dirt. Not the best material to make a house out of, but you do you.
item.grass.desc: A block of dirt with some grass on it.
item.wood_shield.desc: A shield made out of wood.
item.iron_shield.desc: A shield made out of wood, with an iron core.
item.gold_shield.desc: A shield made out of wood, with a golden core.
item.poison_potato.desc: A potato that probably shouldn't be eaten.
item.gold_potato.desc: A golden potato. No, it's not butter.
item.gold_cabbage.desc: A golden head of cabbage. Some people use the leaves as decoration.
item.gold_corn.desc: A golden cob of corn. No, it's not butter.
item.butter_corn.desc: A cob of corn, covered in butter.
item.butter.desc: A bar of butter. No, it's not golden.
item.oak_table.desc: A table made of oak planks. You can put things on it.
item.birch_table.desc: A table made of birch planks. You can put things on it.
item.oak_chair.desc: A chair made of oak planks. You can sit on it.
item.birch_chair.desc: A chair made of birch planks. You can sit on it.
item.fold_chair.desc: A chair made of iron. It can fold into a smaller form.
item.wheat_bundle.desc: A bundle of wheat. You can't eat it raw, but you can make it into dough.
item.gold_wheat.desc: A bundle of golden wheat. You can make it into dough, or equip it.
item.apple_pie.desc: A pie with apples in it.
item.gold_apple_pie.desc: A golden pie with golden apples in it.
item.bread.desc: An entire loaf of bread. You could probably slice it.
item.wood_hoe.desc: A hoe made out of wood. There isn't much of a point for this.
item.stone_hoe.desc: A hoe made out of stone. There isn't much of a point for this.
item.gold_hoe.desc: A hoe made out of gold. There isn't much of a point for this.
item.iron_hoe.desc: A hoe made out of iron. There isn't much of a point for this.
item.diamond_hoe.desc: A hoe made out of diamond. Why did you make this?
item.gold_legs.desc: A pair of leggings made of gold.
item.gold_boots.desc: A pair of boots made of gold.
item.iron_legs.desc: A pair of leggings made of iron.
item.iron_boots.desc: A pair of boots made of iron.
item.red_mushroom.desc: A mushroom with a spotted red cap.
item.brown_mushroom.desc: A mushroom with a brown cap.
item.wood_fish_rod.desc: A fishing rod made of wood.
item.stone_fish_rod.desc: A fishing rod made of stone.
item.gold_fish_rod.desc: A fishing rod made of gold.
item.iron_fish_rod.desc: A fishing rod made of iron.
item.diamond_fish_rod.desc: A fishing rod made of diamond.
item.old_boot.desc: An old boot you fished up.
item.old_boot_pair.desc: A pair of old boots you fished up. Surprisingly effective at defending you.
item.string_wad.desc: A wad of String you fished up.
item.jellyfish.desc: A small jellyfish. Packs a mean sting.
item.gold_goldfish.desc: Like a goldfish, but actually gold.
item.spinach.desc: A bunch of spinach. Supposedly makes you stronger.
item.gold_spinach.desc: A bunch of gold spinach. Actually makes you stronger.
item.ripe_apple.desc: An apple that's riper than usual.
item.ripe_orange.desc: An orange that's riper than usual.
item.ripe_carrot.desc:
A carrot that's riper than usual. It's oranger.

A dragon would probably like this.
item.ripe_can.desc: A can of beans that's riper than usual.
item.ripe_radish.desc: A radish that's riper than usual.
item.ripe_potato.desc: A potato that's riper than usual.
item.ripe_cabbage.desc: A head of cabbage that's riper than usual.
item.ripe_corn.desc: A cob of corn that's riper than usual.
item.ripe_beetroot.desc: A beetroot that's riper than usual. Can be turned into red dye.
item.ripe_wheat_bundle.desc: A bundle of wheat that's riper than usual. Still can't be eaten directly, though.
item.ripe_spinach.desc: A bunch of spinach that's riper than usual.
item.ench_gold_carrot.desc: An enchanted carrot made out of gold. Surprisingly rare.
item.ench_gold_apple.desc: An enchanted golden apple. This is really rare!
item.potion_red.desc: A bottle filled with a red liquid. Who knows what it does?
item.potion_orange.desc: A bottle filled with an orange liquid. Who knows what it does?
item.potion_yellow.desc: A bottle filled with a yellow liquid. Who knows what it does?
item.potion_green.desc: A bottle filled with a green liquid. Who knows what it does?
item.potion_cyan.desc: A bottle filled with a cyan liquid. Who knows what it does?
item.potion_blue.desc: A bottle filled with a blue liquid. Who knows what it does?
item.potion_purple.desc: A bottle filled with a purple liquid. Who knows what it does?
item.splash_potion_red.desc: A bottle filled with a red liquid, meant to be thrown. Who knows what it does?
item.splash_potion_orange.desc: A bottle filled with an orange liquid, meant to be thrown. Who knows what it does?
item.splash_potion_yellow.desc: A bottle filled with a yellow liquid, meant to be thrown. Who knows what it does?
item.splash_potion_green.desc: A bottle filled with a green liquid, meant to be thrown. Who knows what it does?
item.splash_potion_cyan.desc: A bottle filled with a cyan liquid, meant to be thrown. Who knows what it does?
item.splash_potion_blue.desc: A bottle filled with a blue liquid, meant to be thrown. Who knows what it does?
item.splash_potion_purple.desc: A bottle filled with a purple liquid, meant to be thrown. Who knows what it does?
item.empty_slot.desc: This slot used to have an item, but now it doesn't.
item.cooked_gold_goldfish.desc: It's melted a little from the heat.
item.cooked_goldfish.desc: A small goldfish, cooked to perfection.
item.leather.desc: A piece of leather, probably from a cow.
item.bone.desc: A single bone. Why do bones always look like that, anyway?
item.wool.desc: A block of wool from a sheep.
item.rotten_flesh.desc: Some rotting flesh from a zombie. I guess you could eat it?
item.cooked_flesh.desc: Some rotting flesh that's been cooked. Probably safer to eat now.
item.gold_flesh.desc: Some golden flesh. Yes, this is a thing that exists.
item.slime_ball.desc: A ball of green slime. It's somewhat sweet.
item.red_slime_ball.desc: A ball of red slime. It's somewhat spicy.
item.blue_slime_ball.desc: A ball of blue slime. It's somewhat salty.
item.yellow_slime_ball.desc: A ball of yellow slime. It's somewhat bitter.
item.purple_slime_ball.desc: A ball of purple slime. It's poisonous.
item.fuel_units.desc: This recipe requires {units} units of fuel.
item.fuel_unit.desc: This recipe requires 1 unit of fuel.
item.fuel_units_none.desc: This recipe requires 0 units of fuel, somehow.
item.stocking.desc: A stocking for Christmas. Hang it up during your turn to get extra rewards!
item.effect_candy.desc: A small piece of candy, wrapped in a blue wrapper. Eat it to gain a random positive effect!
item.skill_candy.desc: A small piece of candy, wrapped in a green wrapper. Eat it to gain 300% in a random skill!
item.item_candy.desc: A small piece of candy, wrapped in a red wrapper. Eat it to gain a random item!
item.gift_box.desc: A gift in a box. It could be anything!
item.time_candy.desc: A small piece of candy, wrapped in a black and yellow wrapper. If you have this in your inventory, you'll be allowed three posts in a turn, instead of two!
item.old_candy.desc: A small piece of old candy. The color on the wrapper has faded away, so you can't tell what kind of candy this was.
item.old_stocking.desc: An old stocking for Christmas. It's too late to hang it up, but there might still be something inside...
item.furnace.desc: A furnace. Having this in your inventory will passively reduce fuel requirements in recipies by 1.
item.box.desc: A box. It has the following items in it:
item.hammer.desc: A hammer capable of messing with Structures.
item.sponge.desc: A sponge. It can absorb water, and the abrasive side is kinda scratchy.
item.esolang.desc:
An "esoteric language". You're not sure what it does, or how to use it, but that's the fun part!
Skill level:
item.chain_legs.desc: A pair of leggings made of chainmail.
item.chain_boots.desc: A pair of boots made of chainmail.
item.clover4.desc: A clover with 4 leaves. Supposedly brings you luck.
item.clover8.desc: A clover with 8 leaves. This is really lucky!
item.raw_beef.desc: Some raw beef from a cow. You should probably cook it.
item.raw_pork.desc: Some raw pork from a pig. You should probably cook it.
item.raw_chicken.desc: Some raw chicken from a chicken. You should probably cook it.
item.raw_mutton.desc: Some raw mutton from a sheep. You should probably cook it.
item.meat_paste.desc: A paste made from some meat. What, exactly, would you do with this?
item.chocolate_chip_cookie.desc: A cookie with chocolate chips inside. A classic.
item.apple_cookie.desc: A cookie with small chunks of apples inside.
item.carrot_cookie.desc:
A cookie with small ribbons of carrot inside. It's like a carrot cake, but a cookie.

A dragon would probably like this.
item.chocolate_bar.desc: A bar made of solid chocolate. Yummy.
item.iron_staff.desc:
A staff made of iron.
For some reason, you get the feeling that this will be useful...
item.orange_pie.desc: A pie with oranges in it.
item.shepherds_pie.desc: A pie with meat in it, topped with mashed potatoes.
item.gold_cherries.desc: A handful of golden cherries. Not sure what they have to do with ballet, but ok.
item.gold_blackberries.desc: A handful of golden blackberries. What, exactly, could you craft with these?
item.gold_peach.desc: A golden peach. I guess you could carve it?
item.gold_pear.desc: A golden pear. No clue how you'd use this to build.
item.blackberry_pie.desc: A pie with blackberries in it.
item.cherry_pie.desc: A pie with cherries in it.
item.pumpkin_pie.desc: A pie with pumpkin in it. A staple of fall.
item.peach_pie.desc: A pie with peaches in it.
item.apple_can.desc: A can with apple slices in it.
item.orange_can.desc: A can with orange slices in it.
item.peach_can.desc: A can with peach slices in it.
item.pear_can.desc: A can with pear slices in it.
item.carrot_can.desc:
A can with carrots in it.

A dragon would probably like this, if it can open it.
item.potato_can.desc: A can with potatoes in it.
item.corn_can.desc: A can with corn in it.
item.blueberry_can.desc: A can with blueberries in it.
item.cherry_can.desc: A can with cherries in it.
item.radish_can.desc: A can with radish slices in it.
item.baby_carrots.desc:
Some baby carrots.

A small dragon would probably like these.
item.bucket.desc: A bucket. It can hold liquids, or be used as a helmet.
item.lava_bucket.desc: A bucket filled with lava. Somehow, it's not melting.
item.sticker_book.desc: A book for you to put stickers in.
item.sticker_page.desc: An extra page for your sticker book. Fits 4 stickers.
item.sticker_sword.desc:
A sticker of a diamond sword.
[St1, 1, C]
item.sticker_sword_rare.desc:
A raised sticker of a diamond sword. It's too bad you can't take the sword off and attack people with it.
[St1, 2, R]
item.sticker_shield.desc:
A sticker of a diamond shield.
[St1, 3, C]
item.sticker_shield_rare.desc:
A raised sticker of a diamond shield. Too bad the diamond's fake.
[St1, 4, R]
item.sticker_knife.desc:
A sticker of a knife. How'd this get in the game before an actual knife?
[St1, 5, C]
item.sticker_knife_rare.desc:
A raised sticker of a knife.
[St1, 6, R]
item.sticker_bow.desc:
A sticker of a bow.
[St1, 7, C]
item.sticker_bow_rare.desc:
A raised sticker of a bow. The string is made of actual string.
[St1, 8, R]
item.sticker_iron.desc:
A sticker of a lump of iron ore.
[St1, 9, C]
item.sticker_iron_rare.desc:
A raised sticker of a lump of iron ore.
[St1, 10, R]
item.sticker_apple.desc:
A sticker of an apple. The fruit, not the cat.
[St1, 11, C]
item.sticker_apple_rare.desc:
A raised sticker of an apple.
[St1, 12, R]
item.sticker_carrot.desc:
A sticker of a carrot.
[St1, 13, C]
item.sticker_carrot_rare.desc:
A raised sticker of a carrot. It smells like a carrot.
[St1, 14, R]
item.sticker_sap.desc:
A sticker of some sap.
[St1, 15, C]
item.sticker_sap_rare.desc:
A raised sticker of some sap. The sap isn't sticky, but the sticker is.
[St1, 16, R]
item.stone_shield.desc: A shield made out of wood, with a stone core.
item.sticker_pack_cyan.desc: A pack of two stickers. Open it and see what you get!
item.dragon_trans_potion.desc:
A bottle filled with a strange liquid. It... turns you into a dragon, apparently.

What on earth is going on over there?!
item.sticker_orb.desc:
A sticker of an orb. Looks more like a circle to me.
[St1, 17, UC]
item.sticker_orb_rare.desc:
A raised sticker of an orb. Kind of an "all-rounder", if you catch my drift.
[St1, 18, VR]
item.ripe_blueberries.desc: A handful of blueberries that are riper than usual.
item.ripe_cherries.desc: A handful of cherries that are riper than usual. Can be turned into red dye.
item.ripe_blackberries.desc: A handful of blackberries that are riper than usual.
item.ripe_peach.desc: A peach that's riper than usual. Very juicy.
item.ripe_pear.desc: A pear that's riper than usual.
item.gold_lemon.desc: A golden lemon. It's so sour that it can channel sourness into strength. Somehow.
item.ripe_lemon.desc: A lemon that's riper than usual. Even more sour than a lemon.
item.gold_lime.desc: A golden lime. Are you sure this isn't a lemon?
item.ripe_lime.desc: A lime that's riper than usual. Even more sour than a lime.
item.lemon_juice.desc: The juice of a lemon. Very sour.
item.lime_juice.desc: The juice of a lime. Quite sour.
item.lemonade.desc: Some lemonade. The sweetness of the sugar balances out the sourness of the lemon.
item.limeade.desc: Some limeade. If you can make it with lemons, why not limes?
item.sugar.desc: A pile of sugar. It's sweet.
item.popcorn.desc: Some popcorn. A movie theater staple.
item.heart_chocolate.desc: A small chocolate in the shape of a heart. What could be inside it?
item.you_tried.desc: A golden badge in the shape of a star.
item.wood_band.desc: A band made of wood, to go around your wrist.
item.stone_band.desc: A band made of stone, to go around your wrist.
item.iron_band.desc: A band made of iron, to go around your wrist.
item.gold_band.desc: A band made of gold, to go around your wrist.
item.diamond_band.desc: A band made of diamond, to go around your wrist.
item.chalk.desc: A block of chalk. It's dusty.
item.lamp_oil.desc: A container of lamp oil. It's very flammable.
item.lamp_oil_used.desc: A container with some lamp oil in it. It's very flammable.
item.lamp_oil_near_empty.desc: A container with a little bit of lamp oil in it. It's very flammable.
item.pearl.desc: A small, spherical pearl. Pearls that are naturally spherical are pretty rare.
item.quartz.desc: A shard of white quartz. Sometimes, it comes in different colors, but then it has a different name.
item.sapphire.desc: A sapphire. Why do these end up teardrop-shaped so often?
item.ruby.desc: A small ruby. Aren't these normally square, rather than... I think that's an octagon?
item.thunder_stone.desc:
It's brimming with electricity. One of these could probably power up a weapon signifcantly.
...if you have the right weapon.
item.rope.desc: A coil of rope. You can climb it, if it's hung off of something.
item.topaz.desc: A single topaz. At least, it's shaped like a topaz. The color's weird.
item.ruby_sapphire_bar.desc: Look, I know that rubies and sapphires are just different colors of the same mineral, but that doesn't mean this makes sense.
item.electrum_ore.desc: Some electrum ore. Can be crafted into bars, requiring 1 ore per bar.
item.electrum_bar.desc: A bar of electrum. Touching it gives a light static shock.
item.electrum_nugget.desc: A nugget of electrum. It's like a weak battery.
item.gunpowder.desc: Some black powder. Careful, it's flammable. And explosive.
item.snowball_with_rock.desc: A ball of snow with a rock in it.
item.lever.desc: A lever. You can push it to make electricity flow.
item.oak_button.desc: A button made of oak planks. You can push it to make electricity flow.
item.birch_button.desc: A button made of birch planks. You can push it to make electricity flow.
item.stone_button.desc: A button made of stone. You can push it to make electricity flow.
item.iron_button.desc: A button made of iron. You can push it to make electricity flow.
item.oak_plate.desc: A pressure plate made of oak planks. You can push it to make electricity flow.
item.birch_plate.desc: A pressure plate made of birch planks. You can push it to make electricity flow.
item.stone_plate.desc: A pressure plate made of stone. You can push it to make electricity flow.
item.wire.desc: A string of wire. Electricity can flow through it.
item.disp_phone.desc: A cheap phone. You can make calls on it, but it's so poorly made that it breaks when hung up.
item.reuse_phone.desc:
A once-cheap phone, augmented with hardite to strengthen it. The downside is that it chugs through electrum nuggets like water, which is why it has three battery slots.
Battery status:
item.used_disp_phone.desc: A cheap phone, which was broken, tossed into the sea, and then fished back up again.
item.morshu_crate.desc: A crate from Morshu, containing lamp oil, rope, and bombs.
item.takeout_crate.desc: A cardboard box with a crate-like pattern, filled with various food.
item.junes_pizza.desc: A pepperoni pizza from the "local" Mama June's Pizza.
item.junes_cheese_pizza.desc: A cheese pizza from the "local" Mama June's Pizza.
item.junes_meat_pizza.desc: A pizza from the "local" Mama June's Pizza with three different kinds of meat on it.
item.junes_pineapple_pizza.desc: A hawaiian pizza from the "local" Mama June's Pizza. Did you know that hawaiian pizza isn't named after the state?
item.coin.desc: A coin that you minted yourself. It's obviously counterfeit, since you just swirled the gold and copper together, but for some reason all the stores you call will take it anyway?
item.cooked_cod.desc: A small cod, cooked to perfection.
item.seaweed.desc: A square of raw seaweed. Probably not that useful.
item.red_herring.desc: This is clearly the most important item in the entire game.
item.spin_fish.desc: A really large fish. It's too large to eat, but you could spin it to knock people off of things.
item.fish_bag.desc: A bag containing a number of fish.
item.potion_enchant.desc: A bottle filled with a bunch of skill experience.
item.chest.desc: A chest. You can put it in a structure.
item.coin_good.desc:
An official coin from the Isles of Fighting.

You know, the country that Trisland is technically in.
item.dollar_bill.desc: An official dollar bill from the Isles of Fighting. Valued at 4 coins.
item.five_dollar_bill.desc: An official five dollar bill from the Isles of Fighting. Valued at 20 coins.
item.geode.desc: It may look like an ordinary rock, but it actually contains several gems.
item.contact_card_wet.desc: A small card with a phone number and a name on it. It's soaked from being underwater, but is still legible.
item.contact_card_dry.desc: A small card with a phone number and a name on it.
item.penny.desc: A decicoin that you minted yourself. It's clearly counterfeit, given all the dents, but for some reason all the stores you call will take it anyway? Valued at 1/10th of a coin.
item.penny_good.desc: An official decicoin from the Isles of Fighting. Valued at 1/10th of a coin.
item.gold_tomato.desc: A golden tomato. See, it boosts Charisma because of people throwing tomatoes at comedians. Makes total sense, doesn't it?
item.ripe_tomato.desc: A tomato that's riper than usual.
item.bomb.desc: A bomb. You can light it and throw it at something to blow it up.
item.dragon_youth_potion.desc:
A bottle filled with a strange liquid. When used on a dragon, it'll set their age to 1.

What a weird potion.


It smells oddly sweet.
item.dragon_age_potion.desc:
A bottle filled with a strange liquid. When used on a dragon, it'll lock their age, preventing them from growing older.

Wait, if you combined these two...!


It smells oddly sour.
item.shrapnel_bomb.desc: A bomb with cracks in it, designed to break into shrapnel after exploding.
item.scroll_01_04.desc: A scroll with the first and fourth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_01_21.desc: A scroll that allows you to gain several ores.
item.scroll_01_05.desc: A scroll with the first and fifth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_01_03.desc: A scroll with the first and third runes printed on it.
item.scroll_01_07.desc: A scroll with the first and seventh runes printed on it.

item.scroll_01_08.desc: A scroll with the first and eigth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_01_15.desc: A scroll that grants skill Exp.
item.scroll_01_16.desc: A scroll with the first and sixteenth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_01_17.desc: A scroll with the first and seventeenth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_01_18.desc: A scroll with the first and eighteenth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_14_15.desc: A scroll that grants Misc EXP.
item.scroll_14_20.desc: A scroll with the fourteenth and twentieth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_15_29.desc:
A scroll that grants you the knowledge of the first 100 digits of pi.
Not very useful.
item.scroll_25_31.desc: A scroll with the twenty-fifth and thirty-first runes printed on it.
item.scroll_03_29.desc: A scroll with the third and twenty-ninth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_23_23.desc: A scroll with the twenty-third rune printed on it twice.
item.scroll_04_04.desc: A scroll with the fourth rune printed on it twice.
item.scroll_13_24.desc: A scroll with the thirteenth and twenty-fourth runes printed on it.

item.scroll_01_29.desc: A scroll that gives you some nice pie.

item.scroll_20_05.desc: A scroll with the twentieth and fifth runes printed on it.

item.chef_apron.desc: An apron with a funny message.
item.one_hand_book.desc: A book designed to be held with one hand. It boosts Charisma because it's a joke book.
item.fabric.desc: Some fabric, to make into clothes.

item.plain_shirt.desc: A plain shirt, made with cotton.

item.knife.desc: Oh hey, it's the knife from the sticker.
item.ice_egg.desc: A large, cyan egg. It's probably from a dragon or something.
item.tainted_carrot.desc:
A carrot covered in what is probably those two mystery potions.

Uh oh.
item.idleon_gem.desc: A Gem, perfect for the Gem Shop. You know, the one in a different game.
item.prize.desc: A yellow box with orange stripes. Open it for a reward!
item.smurf_hat.desc: A hat typically worn by Smeckledorf Smurfs.
item.sticker_goldfish.desc:
A sticker of a goldfish.
[St2, 1, C]
item.sticker_goldfish_rare.desc:
A raised sticker of a goldfish. Smells fishy.
[St2, 2, R]
item.sticker_basket.desc:
A sticker of a hand basket.
[St2, 3, C]
item.sticker_basket_rare.desc:
A raised sticker of a hand basket.
[St2, 4, R]
item.sticker_bottle.desc:
A sticker of a glass bottle.
[St2, 5, C]
item.sticker_bottle_rare.desc:
A raised sticker of a glass bottle. Not actually made of glass.
[St2, 6, R]
item.sticker_hammer.desc:
A sticker of a hammer.
[St2, 7, C]
item.sticker_hammer_rare.desc:
A raised sticker of a hammer.
[St2, 8, R]
item.sticker_dirt.desc:
A sticker of a block of dirt.
[St2, 9, C]
item.sticker_dirt_rare.desc:
A raised sticker of a block of dirt. Ooh, scratch n' sniff!
[St2, 10, R]
item.depleted_electrum_nugget.desc: A depleted nugget of electrum. It's like a dead battery.
item.sticker_pack_st2.desc: A pack of two stickers. Open it and see what you get!
item.sticker_pack_all.desc: A pack of two stickers. Open it and see what you get!
item.depleted_electrum_bar.desc: A depleted bar of electrum. Since there's no electricity in it anymore, you could probably used it to make tools.
item.real_knife.desc:
Uh oh.

Wait, why bonus damage against dragons?
item.emerald_legs.desc: A pair of leggings made of emerald.
item.emerald_boots.desc: A pair of boots made of emerald.
item.emerald_shield.desc: A shield with an emerald in the center.
item.emerald_band.desc: A band made of emerald, to go around your wrist.
item.emerald_sword.desc: A sword made out of emeralds.
item.emerald_shovel.desc: A shovel made out of emeralds.
item.emerald_pickaxe.desc: A pickaxe made out of emeralds.
item.emerald_axe.desc: A axe made out of emeralds.
item.emerald_hoe.desc: A hoe made out of emerald. Why did you make this?
item.emerald_fish_rod.desc: A fishing rod made of emerald.
item.hardite_legs.desc: A pair of leggings made of hardite.
item.hardite_boots.desc: A pair of boots made of hardite.
item.hardite_shield.desc: A shield made out of wood, with a hardite core.
item.hardite_band.desc: A band made of hardite, to go around your wrist.
item.hardite_sword.desc: A sword made out of hardite.
item.hardite_shovel.desc: A shovel made out of hardite.
item.hardite_pickaxe.desc: A pickaxe made out of hardite.
item.hardite_axe.desc: A axe made out of hardite.
item.hardite_hoe.desc: A hoe made out of hardite. Since <u>Achievements</u> aren't a thing, you have basically no reason to have made this. Except for the Farming bonus, I guess.
item.hardite_fish_rod.desc: A fishing rod made of hardite.
item.leather_legs.desc: A pair of pants made of leather.
item.leather_boots.desc: A pair of shoes made of leather.
item.mine.desc: A landmine. You can place it by a Structure, Crop, or Plant to make it blow up when someone goes near it.
item.red_rose.desc: A red rose. Can be turned into red dye.
item.pink_rose.desc: A pink rose. Can be turned into pink dye.
item.white_rose.desc: A white rose. Can be turned into white dye.
item.blue_rose.desc: A blue rose. Can be turned into blue dye.
item.ice_rock.desc: A strange rock that's cold to the touch.
item.cant_use_slot.desc: For whatever reason, this mob can't use this equipment slot.
item.no_ripe.desc: This crop does not have a ripe form.
item.poisonberry.desc:
Also called Bittersweet Nightshade, this is a real thing.
Can be crafted into a Vial of Poison.
item.ripe_poisonberry.desc:
A poisonberry that's riper than usual.
Can be crafted into a Vial of Poison.
item.gold_poisonberry.desc: A golden poisonberry. It channels the poison into your muscles, which is more beneficial than you'd think. Still hurts, though.
item.poison_juice.desc: A vial of poison. You can put it on stuff.
item.salt.desc: A pile of salt. It's salty.
item.msg.desc: Yes, you did in fact make this using seaweed and an anchovy. It's a real recipe; why else would it have been used in the Krabby Patty episode of Binging with Babish?
item.anchovy.desc: A small anchovy. You probably don't need to cook it.
item.electrum_dust.desc: A pile of electrum dust. It's like redstone, but green, and also made redundant by the Wire String.
item.gold_dust.desc: A pile of gold dust. May or may not be edible.
item.poison_powder.desc: A pile of poisonous powder. Be careful not to breath it in.
item.sleep_powder.desc: A pile of sleep-inducing powder. It smells like chloroform.
item.static_powder.desc: A pile of paralytic powder. Be careful not to swallow it.
item.spark_dust.desc: A pile of warm dust. It's quite flammable, and can be ignited using only pressure.
item.glass_dust.desc: A pile of glass, in dust form. This hurts your hands just touching it.
item.nitro_dust.desc: A pile of explosive dust. Be really careful with it; if you aren't, it might explode on you.
item.exp_candy_s.desc: You just put sugar on a ball of sap. Somehow, this works.
item.grapes.desc: Some grapes. If you run a lemonade stand, keep some of these handy.
item.ripe_grapes.desc: Some grapes that are riper than usual. Can be turned into purple dye.
item.gold_grapes.desc: Some golden grapes. Not really sure where the Dexterity comes from, but okay.
item.wallet.desc: A wallet. You put money in it.
item.dust_pouch.desc: A pouch, to store various dusts and powders.
item.d6.desc: A single die with six sides, also called a d6. Who knows what'll happen when you use this?
item.scroll_32_31.desc: A scroll with the thirty-second and thirty-first runes printed on it.
item.scroll_12_12.desc: A scroll with the twelfth rune printed on it twice.
item.scroll_13_13.desc: A scroll with the thirteenth rune printed on it twice.
item.scroll_33_21.desc: A scroll with the thirty-third and twenty-first runes printed on it.
item.scroll_01_37.desc: A scroll with the first and thirty-seventh runes printed on it.
item.scroll_01_36.desc: A scroll with the first and thirty-sixth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_34_21.desc: A scroll with the thirty-fourth and twenty-first runes printGoldened on it.
item.scroll_34_17.desc: A scroll with the thirty-fourth and seventeenth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_35_29.desc: A scroll with the thirty-fifth and twenty-ninth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_23_37.desc: A scroll with the twenty-third and thirty-seventh runes printed on it.
item.scroll_17_37.desc: A scroll with the seventeenth and thirty-seventh runes printed on it.
item.scroll_27_12.desc: A scroll with the twenty-seventh and twelfth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_13_17.desc: A scroll with the thirteenth and seventeenth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_09_36.desc: A scroll with the ninth and thirty-sixth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_33_36.desc: A scroll with the thirty-third and thirty-sixth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_33_04.desc: A scroll with the thirty-third and fourth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_03_32.desc: A scroll with the third and thirty-second runes printed on it.
item.scroll_27_02.desc: A scroll with the twenty-seventh and second runes printed on it.
item.scroll_29_04.desc: A scroll with the twenty-ninth and fourth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_37_36.desc: A scroll with the thirty-seventh and thirty-sixth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_09_40.desc: A scroll with the ninth and fortieth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_32_02.desc: A scroll with the thirty-second and second runes printed on it.
item.scroll_32_08.desc: A scroll with the thirty-second and eighth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_32_24.desc: A scroll with the thirty-second and twenty-fourth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_01_40.desc: A scroll with the first and fortieth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_01_34.desc: A scroll with the first and thirty-fourth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_01_25.desc: A scroll with the first and twenty-fifth runes printed on it.
item.scroll_02_07.desc: A scroll with the second and seventh runes printed on it.
item.scroll_09_29.desc: A scroll with the ninth and twenty-ninth runes printed on it.
item.olive.desc: A single olive. Goes well on pizza.
item.ripe_olive.desc: A single olive that's riper than usual.
item.gold_olive.desc: A single golden olive. Not sure how olives make you smart, but it's worth a shot.
item.ripe_pepper.desc: A pepper that's riper than usual. It's even spicier.
item.blocking_shield.desc: A wooden shield reinforced with an iron cross. Unlike other shields, this one increases Block Range.
item.coconut.desc: A coconut. It has water in it.
item.ripe_coconut.desc: A coconut that's riper than usual. It has more water in it.
item.gold_coconut.desc: A golden coconut. Now you have water!
item.white_tulip.desc: A white tulip. Can be turned into white dye.
item.sunflower.desc: A sunflower. Can be turned into yellow dye.
item.egg_chocolate.desc: A small chocolate in the shape of an egg. What could be inside it?
item.iron_nugget.desc: A nugget of iron. It's like a rock, but iron.
item.copper_nugget.desc: A nugget of copp- oh great, it's already started oxidizing.
item.gold_nugget.desc: A nugget of gold. It's like a hundred-dollar bill, except curse-made gold isn't worth much.
item.hardite_nugget.desc:
A nugget of hardite. It's like a nugget of power.

Wait, why are you trying to eat it?
item.hank_hotdog.desc: A hotdog, wrapped in foil. Looks like it has ketchup and mustard.
item.bun.desc: A little bun with some butter on it.
item.moss_block.desc: A block of [Moss]. It's too big to eat.
item.moss_carpet.desc: A thin layer of [Moss], that you can put on other blocks. It's basically nature's carpet.
item.cobblestone.desc:
Finally, some cobblestone!

wait why do the tools still use regular stone
item.moss_cobblestone.desc: A cube of cobblestone with some [Moss] on it.
item.iron_block.desc: A block of solid iron. Hopefully it won't rust.
item.gold_block.desc: A block of solid gold. At least it looks pretty.
item.diamond_block.desc: A block of solid diamond. Wow, this will sell for a lot!
item.emerald_block.desc: A block of solid emerald. Wow, this will sell for a lot!
item.dispenser.desc: A dispenser. If you activate it, it'll shoot out what's inside if it can, or drop it if it can't.
item.dropper.desc: A dropper. If you activate it, it'll drop what's inside, right onto the ground.
item.shooter.desc: A shooter. If you activate it, it'll shoot out what's inside, no matter what.
item.lucky_block.desc:
A block made of what seems to be solid gold. When you break it, something interesting will happen!
Luck:
item.sleep_shroom.desc:
A azure mushroom with pale yellow spots. It has the unique property of its toxins inducing sleep and doing nothing else.
Can be crafted into Sleep Powder.
item.gold_sleep_shroom.desc: A golden mushroom with golden spots. It makes you feel drowsy just by looking at it.
item.thunder_knife.desc:
Uh oh.

No, really, where's all this bonus damage coming from?
item.quiver.desc: A quiver. It can store arrows.
item.bread_slice.desc: A single slice of bread. You could make a sandwich, or toast it.
item.ruler.desc: A ruler. You can use it to measure things.
item.grape_juice.desc: The juice from a bunch of grapes.
item.pineapple_juice.desc: The juice from a pineapple. It's somewhat acidic.
item.ripe_pineapple.desc: A pineapple that's riper than usual. It's more acidic.
item.gold_pineapple.desc:
A golden pineapple. Now you're acidic!
No, I don't know how that translates to Plant-aligned damage.
item.ripe_mango.desc: A mango that's riper than usual.
item.gold_mango.desc: A golden mango. I guess you could try to sculpt it.
item.tag.desc: A tag. You can put it on an item to put a little icon in the corner.
item.pink_tag.desc: A tag that's been dyed pink.
item.red_tag.desc: A tag that's been dyed red.
item.orange_tag.desc: A tag that's been dyed orange.
item.brown_tag.desc: A tag that's been dyed brown.
item.yellow_tag.desc: A tag that's been dyed yellow.
item.green_tag.desc: A tag that's been dyed green.
item.cyan_tag.desc: A tag that's been dyed cyan.
item.blue_tag.desc: A tag that's been dyed blue.
item.purple_tag.desc: A tag that's been dyed purple.
item.magenta_tag.desc: A tag that's been dyed magenta.
item.white_tag.desc: A tag that's been dyed white.
item.gray_tag.desc: A tag that's been dyed gray.
item.black_tag.desc: A tag that's been dyed black.
item.scraps.desc: A pile of scraps with some sort of magical power. What'd you do, rip up a scroll?
item.name_tag.desc: A name tag. You can use it on an item to give it a custom name.
item.desc_tag.desc: A description tag. You can use it on an items to give it a custom description.
item.attr_tag.desc: An attribute tag. You can use it on an items to give it (non-functional) custom attributes.
item.fire_charge.desc: A fire charge. You can use it to light things on fire.
item.crown.desc: A crown made of gold, with gems embedded within it. It's not very good at defense, but it makes you look important.
item.calculator.desc: A small pocket calculator. It can't do much, but at least it's cheap.
item.burger.desc: A hamburger. It has some lettuce and tomato on it.
item.cheese_burger.desc: A cheeseburger. It has some lettuce and tomato on it. Plus cheese
item.gold_burger.desc: A hamburger made of gold. It has some golden lettuce and golden tomato on it.
item.lettuce.desc: A head of lettuce. It's name comes from the fact that if you put it in crushed ice, it looks like an iceberg.
item.ripe_lettuce.desc: A head of lettuce that's riper than usual.
item.gold_lettuce.desc: A golden head of lettuce. Go on, guess what it boosts.
item.light_gray_dye.desc: A blob of light gray dye.
item.dark_green_dye.desc:
A blob of dark green dye.

Lime? What's that?
item.light_blue_dye.desc: A blob of light blue dye.
item.icing_bottle.desc: A bottle of icing. Isn't icing normally stored in pipets or something?
item.cake_full.desc: A cake with frosting and cherries. But where did the cherries come from?
item.cake_three_quarter.desc: Three-quarters of a cake with frosting and cherries.
item.cake_half.desc: Half of a cake with frosting and cherries.
item.cake_quarter.desc: A quarter of a cake with frosting and cherries.
item.cake_slice.desc: A slice of cake. Shouldn't this be bigger?
item.carrot_cake_full.desc:
A cake with ribbons of carrot in it.

A dragon would probably like this.
item.carrot_cake_three_quarter.desc:
Three-quarters of a cake with ribbons of carrot in it.

A dragon would probably like this.
item.carrot_cake_half.desc:
Half of a cake with ribbons of carrot in it.

A dragon would probably like this.
item.carrot_cake_quarter.desc:
A quarter of a cake with ribbons of carrot in it.

A dragon would probably like this.
item.carrot_cake_slice.desc:
A slice of carrot cake. Wasn't the carrot on to bigger than that, and also centered?

A dragon would probably like this.
item.lava_bottle.desc: A bottle filled with lava. I mean, I guess glass is more heat-resistant than iron.
item.raw_patty.desc: You know, burger patties are usually not hockey puck-shaped.
item.cooked_patty.desc: A cooked burger patty. You can still tell that it's hockey puck-shaped.
item.pumpkin.desc: A pumpkin. These are normally not cubic.
item.pumpkin_half.desc: Half of a pumpkin. ...Did you just... eat it raw?
item.ripe pumpkin.desc: A pumpkin that's riper than usual.
item.ripe pumpkin_half.desc: Half of a pumpkin that's riper than usual.
item.golden pumpkin.desc: A golden pumpkin. See, it boosts Dark-aligned damage because Halloween.
item.watermelon.desc: A watermelon. How'd you make it cubic and edible?
item.watermelon_half.desc: Half of a watermelon. I guess you could eat it like that.
item.ripe watermelon.desc: A watermelon that's riper than usual.
item.ripe watermelon_half.desc: Half of a watermelon that's riper than usual.
item.golden watermelon.desc: A golden watermelon. I mean, you could use the rind as a bottle or something.
item.carved_pumpkin.desc: A pumpkin that's been carved and had it's insides removed.
item.jack_o_lantern.desc: A pumpkin that's been carved and had a torch placed inside.
item.obsidian.desc: A block of solid obsidian. Did you know that obsidian is actually a type of glass?
item.mop.desc: A mop. It can clean things.
item.mop_wet.desc: A wet mop. It can clean things, but right now it'll probably just make them wet.
item.shears.desc: A pair of shears. You can use them to shear things, like wool, grass, and people.

effect.none.desc: Looks like someone forgot to clear the slot.
effect.on_fire.desc: It burns, like fire normally does.
effect.frozen.desc: Where'd all this ice come from, anyway?
effect.ko.desc: Maybe pay more attention to your HP next time?
effect.soaked.desc: You stayed in the rain too long and now you're all soggy.
effect.nausea.desc: You feel sick, and it's kinda hard to see.
effect.atk_up.desc: You feel stronger, and deal more damage.
effect.atk_up+.desc: You feel stronger, and deal more damage.
effect.atk_up++.desc: You feel significantly stronger, and deal more damage.
effect.def_up.desc: You feel sturdier, and take less damage.
effect.def_up+.desc: You feel sturdier, and take less damage.
effect.def_up++.desc: You feel significantly sturdier, and take less damage.
effect.blind.desc: Hey, who turned the lights out?
effect.sleep.desc: The ground isn't a very good place to sleep, you know.
effect.restful_sleep.desc: That's a nice bed you got there.
effect.sour.desc: Wow, that lemon (or lime) was really sour, and now you can't focus.
effect.severe_nausea.desc: You ate WAY too much food, and now you feel like you want to die.
effect.misted.desc: You've been turned to mist, somehow.
effect.leech_seed_user.desc: You threw some seeds at someone, and now you're stealing their health. Neat.
effect.leech_seed_target.desc: Someone threw some seeds at you, and now they're stealing your health. Well, that's annoying.
effect.shackles_pain_user.desc: You're making someone take the damage you take.
effect.shackles_pain_target.desc: Someone's making you take the damage they take.
effect.intimidated.desc: Someone intimidated you, and now you're kinda scared.
effect.very_afk.desc: You ever gonna, like, start playing again? No? Then I call dibs on your inventory.
effect.night_vision.desc:
You are better at seeing at night.

Since your sight during the night is basically the same as during the day, this is just a night-locked sight boost.
effect.fire_charged.desc: You're engulfed in a surprisingly harmless layer of fire. You should put it somewhere.
effect.water_charged.desc: You're covered in a layer of water (yet you can still breathe). You should put it somewhere.
effect.thunder_charged.desc: You're brimming with electricity. You should put it somewhere.
effect.slight_regen.desc: You're recovering a little bit of health.
effect.slight_atk_up.desc: You feel just a bit stronger.
effect.slight_def_up.desc: You feel just a bit sturdier.
effect.itchy.desc: You feel really itchy, and it's distracting you.
effect.minty.desc: Your breath smells like mint. I guess it's better than whatever it smelled like before?
effect.spicy.desc: You ate something spicy and now your mouth feels like it's on fire. It isn't, but it feels like it is.

critter.fly.desc: I'm still not sure why she caught it, but I do know why you caught it.

quests.multi.wiki.name: Make Wiki edits.

quests.multi.crops.desc:
This is a repeatable quest, meaning you can complete it multiple times!
After the big goal is completed, the quest will be removed.
quests.multi.wiki.desc: The edits need to be significant in some way; fixing a typo won't count.

info.paragraph.details_things.1: This page details things miscellaneous information about Fighting Simulator 3.
info.paragraph.formatting.1: FS3 uses various types of formatting to signify different things.
info.paragraph.formatting.2: This section will show what the various types of formatting mean.
info.paragraph.formatting.4: Italic text signifies something that is on the island that everyone fights on.
info.paragraph.formatting.5: <u>Underlined</u> text signifies something that could be added by voting on it.
info.paragraph.formatting.6: Dark green text signifies a phone number.
info.paragraph.gains_info.1: (Values above 20 can only be obtained by having a sufficent level and/or bonus in the skill.)
info.paragraph.level_info.1: This table includes various information about levels themselves.
info.paragraph.skill_bonuses.1: Reaching levels 5 and 10 of a skill will grant bonuses based on the skill.
info.paragraph.skill_bonuses.2: Some skills also grant bonuses at other levels.
info.paragraph.weather.1: Occasionally, the weather will change, resulting in various effects.
info.paragraph.weather.2: Things that rely on the sun will have reduced effectiveness when it's not Day.
info.paragraph.weather.3: This does not apply to plants, and both Night and Partly Cloudy reduce effectiveness less than other weather types.
info.paragraph.item_candy.1: Upon eating an Item Candy, you'll gain one of the following.
info.paragraph.fishing.1: When you go Fishing, the outcome of the luck roll(s) determines what item pool you get an item from.
info.paragraph.fishing.2: The first part is the item and its ID, the second part is how likely you are to get it.
info.skill_bonus.all.5: Critical Misses no longer destroy or damage what's being worked on.
glyphbook.page_missing.text: The pages for this glyph appear to be missing.
